column4: hi all - is it possible to install ubuntu from ubuntu? i.e. install a new version on another partition, from a running ubuntu?
yes.
nice :) got a link to a howto?
got a hint what do google for? i only find stuff for windows.
would it work to download the iso, mount it and start the installer? what is it called?
well, that surely would work. But there is a specific tool (from Debian) to do an install from a running filersystem
check http://linuxmafia.com/faq/Debian/installers.html
not sure what to look for there.
when looking at the iso... what would the instalelr be called? and i hope it's a static binary :P
ahh yes, I'll look a bit more. here it is: http://wiki.debian.org/Debootstrap
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromKnoppix
the method is the same from ubuntu itself.
thanks! i would have thought there should be something pre-rolled. would be cool to be able to do it with apt-get :)

hm... that seems to give me a base system, and i can configrre the rest manually. but really all i want to do is run the normal installer that's also on the cd. much simpler. why would i need to boot fro mthe cd to run the installer?
nothing special.
it's annoying that i have to get the full iso though. would be nice to get *just* the installer. actually... is there a small "network install" iso?
yes.
Neosano: but but... where?! i must be blind.
Neosano: doesn't look like i can run the installer from a mounted iso. it's all compressed into initrd.gz
you can if you boot the ISO.
or if you run 'deboostrap'.
i don't *want* to boot the iso, that#s the entiere point :) i want to run the installer off a runing ubuntu :)
run it into a virtual machine. Else use 'deboostrap'
but debootstrap doesn't run the normal installer. it installs a base system. not what i want.
